Comments_List:
the ability to read literary Chinese faster 
early Ming and late Ming prose style and content
the relationship between fiction/poetry and history
I learned a great deal about Chinese literature and literary genres, a field with which I was largely unfamiliar prior to this seminar.

strength: clear analysis and close reading in the classes; readings are easy to access; fast response from the instructor; office hour

if possible, more readings may be included

The reading materials were excellent and entertaining throughout, as was Dr. Chang's situating of these texts within a larger historical context. Greater discussion of the historyperhaps with some secondary scholarship or readingsmight have been helpful.
Yes, since the content of the course is very inspiring and it enables students to improve their language skills
For those interested in Chinese literature, certainly. Dr. Chang seemed to try to focus on less-studied genres and pieces, which made for an interesting selection of readings.
